caption.p: The “Three Italy” of the COVID-19 epidemic. The highest geographical SARS-CoV-2 spread was reported in the northern regions of Italy and the lowest in the southern regions and in the main Islands. The region of Lombardy has the highest number of cases of SARS-CoV-2 and appears to be the epicenter of the Italian outbreak, unlike regions like Molise, Basilicata, and Sardinia, where the SARS-CoV-2 circulation has been encompassed
